form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cramer (for himself and Mr. Coons) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to give priority in the consideration of suicide prevention grants to entities located in States that have not received such a grant, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Every State Counts for Veterans Mental Health Act.

section.header: Priority for Department of Veterans Affairs suicide prevention grant recipients in States in which a grant has not been awarded
section.text: Section 201(d) of the Commander John Scott Hannon Veterans Mental Health Care Improvement Act of 2019 (Public Law 116â€“171; 10 U.S.C. 1720F note) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Additional priority for States that have not received a grant

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall prioritizing consideration of any eligible entity located in a State in which an entity has applied but not received a grant under this section.

If no entity in a particular State has received a grant under this section, the Secretary shall give all eligible entities in that State that apply for such a grant a scoring preference until at least one grant is awarded to an eligible entity in that State.
